return.desc: A list of CSS classes separated by spaces

descriptor.name: url
descriptor.description:
A template string that will be converted into a URL used to call the tile
service. Should be in the following format:

   `http://{s}.somedomain.com/blabla/{z}/{x}/{y}.png`

The following values will be substituted for letters in `{}` brackets:

- `{s}`: a subdomain to call to allow the browser to make many parallel requests
- `{z}`: the map zoom level
- `{x}` and `{y}`: the coordinates for the tile

descriptor.name: decodeUrl
descriptor.description:
Forces the component to call decodeURI on the `url` attribute before
passing it to the tile service. Use this if your `url` is getting
encoded by the browser before requests are sent (this can happen if
you set the URL attribute with a string instead of data binding).

descriptor.name: notifyInstReady
descriptor.description:
If this element's instance is ready to create and add to its parent,
fires an event the parent will catch.

params.name: isReady
params.description: If `true` instance parent will be notified

descriptor.name: isShadyScoped
descriptor.description:
If this component is being drawn in Shady DOM, returns true. Used to
ensure the shady DOM scope classes are applied when we make DOM
transactions that can't be reviewed by the scopeSubtree observer
in the root `px-map` component that is the parent of all elements.

descriptor.name: getShadyScope
descriptor.description:
Returns the stringified shady DOM scope classes. Useful for ensuring they're
applied during DOM transactions that can't be reviewed by the scopeSubtree
observer in the root `px-map` component that is the parent of all elements.

return.desc: A list of CSS classes separated by spaces

descriptor.name: crs
descriptor.description:
The coordinate reference system to use when projecting geographic points
into pixel coordinates. Can only be set once before the map is first
initialized. If you don't know what this is, do not set it and the map
will default to the most common web mapping projection (EPSG3857).

descriptor.name: lat
descriptor.description:
The latitude of the active map center. Can be used to set or update
the center of the map, or read from after the user moves the map to
get updated coordinates.

descriptor.name: lng
descriptor.description:
The longitude of the active map center. Can be used to set or update
the center of the map, or read from after the user moves the map to
get updated coordinates.

descriptor.name: zoom
descriptor.description:
The zoom level of the active map. Can be used to set or update
the zoom level of the map, or read from after the user changes the
map zoom level to an updated value.

descriptor.name: maxZoom
descriptor.description:
The maximum zoom level for the active map (the furthest the user can
zoom in). Setting it at the map level will take precedence over the
max zoom of all other layers, including tile layers. If you need to
set different zoom bounds based on the visible tile layer, set the
max zoom directly on your tile layer.

descriptor.name: minZoom
descriptor.description:
The minimum zoom level for the active map (the furthest the user can
zoom out). Setting it at the map level will take precedence over the
min zoom of all other layers, including tile layers. If you need to
set different zoom bounds based on the visible tile layer, set the
min zoom directly on your tile layer.

descriptor.name: maxBounds
descriptor.description:
Restricts the user from moving the map outside of a specific geographic
boundary. The user will be bounced back if they attempt to pan outside the view.
Disabled by default, letting the user pan to any point on the map.

Pass an array of [lat,lng] values like the following:

       [[40.712, -74.227], [40.774, -74.125]]

The first pair should represent the southwest extend of the boundary,
and the second  pair should represent the northeast extend of the
boundary.

descriptor.name: disableDragging
descriptor.description:
Set to disable dragging of the map with the mouse or by touch. Use to
restrict changing the map's visible area (e.g. for a static map) or
to set up a map for being updated programmatically (e.g. through regular
responses from an API).

descriptor.name: disableScrollZoom
descriptor.description:
Set to disable zooming with the scroll wheel. Useful if you have a map
that takes up the full width of a page and want to allow the user to
scroll/swipe past without getting stuck in a zoom-in-zoom-out loop.

descriptor.name: disableTouchZoom
descriptor.description: Set to disable the two-finger zoom gesture on touch devices.

descriptor.name: disableDoubleClickZoom
descriptor.description: Set to disable zooming on double-click.

descriptor.name: disableAttribution
descriptor.description:
Set to disable the attribution control, which can be used to show the
source of tile layers or other data overlays.

This property is not dynamic and can only be set once when the map is
first initialized.

descriptor.name: attributionPrefix
descriptor.description: Stringified HTML that will be used as the first item in your attribution list. Pass an tag with a link to more information about your attribution source. Example: 'Example' Defaults to a link to the Leaflet.js library. If an empty string is passed ("") the prefix will be hidden.
descriptor.defaultValue: "Leaflet"

descriptor.name: flexToSize
descriptor.description:
Uses flexbox to set the size of the map. Set the parent container
to use `display: flex;` in your CSS and the map will automatically
fill the container's available height and width.

descriptor.name: notifyInstReady
descriptor.description:
If this element's instance is ready to create and add to its parent,
fires an event the parent will catch.

params.name: isReady
params.description: If `true` instance parent will be notified

descriptor.name: isShadyScoped
descriptor.description:
If this component is being drawn in Shady DOM, returns true. Used to
ensure the shady DOM scope classes are applied when we make DOM
transactions that can't be reviewed by the scopeSubtree observer
in the root `px-map` component that is the parent of all elements.

descriptor.name: getShadyScope
descriptor.description:
Returns the stringified shady DOM scope classes. Useful for ensuring they're
applied during DOM transactions that can't be reviewed by the scopeSubtree
observer in the root `px-map` component that is the parent of all elements.

return.desc: A list of CSS classes separated by spaces

descriptor.name: invalidateSize
descriptor.description:
Checks if the map container has changed size or visibility, and - if so -
updates the map accordingly by refreshing the tile layer.

descriptor.name: latLngIsValid
descriptor.description:
Returns true if lat and lng are valid values that can be used to set a
map's position. Prints an error if values are invalid (unless `hideError`
is set to true).

descriptor.name: getVisibleMarkers
descriptor.description:
Iterates over all markers attached to the map and returns an array of markers
that are within the visible bounds. Use to discover which markers the
user can currently see and change/filter the state of your app.

This is an expensive operation, particularly for maps with many markers
(e.g. in a marker group). Only call it when necessary.

To get continuous updates on which markers are visible, attach a
`px-map-moved` event listener to this element and call this method
after each moved event.

descriptor.name: statusIcon
descriptor.description: The icon to display on the left side of the notification

descriptor.name: content
descriptor.description: The content to display in the notification

descriptor.name: actionIcon
descriptor.description:
The icon or button to display on the right side of the context
notification

descriptor.name: type
descriptor.description:
The type of notification defines the visual styling. Should
be one of important, warning, error, info/information, healthy, or unknown.

descriptor.name: small
descriptor.description:
If true, the height of the notification will be reduced to 40px on
mobile and 20px otherwise. Set this attribute when configuring a
notification with text only (no icons or buttons).

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description:
If true, the notification is visible. Set to false to hide
the notification.

descriptor.name: trigger
descriptor.description:
Reference to the HTML element wrapping around the user-tappable
content. Makes it easy to data-bind a tappable element to the
px-modal `openTrigger` property.

descriptor.name: sizingTarget
descriptor.description:
The element that will receive a `max-height`/`width`. By default it is
the same as `this`, but it can be set to a child element. This is useful,
for example, for implementing a scrolling region inside the element.

descriptor.name: fitInto
descriptor.description: The element to fit `this` into.

descriptor.name: noOverlap
descriptor.description:
Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping
it.

descriptor.name: positionTarget
descriptor.description:
The element that should be used to position the element. If not set, it
will default to the parent node.

descriptor.name: horizontalAlign
descriptor.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "left", "right",
"center", "auto".

descriptor.name: verticalAlign
descriptor.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "top", "bottom",
"middle", "auto".

descriptor.name: dynamicAlign
descriptor.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as
preferred alignment and if there's not enough space, it will pick the
values which minimize the cropping.

descriptor.name: horizontalOffset
descriptor.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `horizontalAlign`.

If `horizontalAlign` is "left" or "center", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the left side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown to the left; a positive one, to the right.

Conversely if `horizontalAlign` is "right", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the right side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown to the right; a positive one, to the left.

descriptor.name: verticalOffset
descriptor.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `verticalAlign`.

If `verticalAlign` is "top" or "middle", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the top side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown upwards; a positive one, downwards.

Conversely if `verticalAlign` is "bottom", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the bottom side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown downwards; a positive one, upwards.

descriptor.name: autoFitOnAttach
descriptor.description: Used by iron-fit-behavior to attach the modal to the Window by default.

descriptor.name: headerText
descriptor.description:
String displayed in the modal header. Override with custom HTML using
the `header` slot.

descriptor.name: bodyText
descriptor.description:
String displayed in the modal body. Override with custom HTML using
the `body` slot.

descriptor.name: acceptText
descriptor.description:
String used for the accept button. Override with a custom button using
the `accept-trigger` slot.

descriptor.name: rejectText
descriptor.description:
String used for the reject button. Override with a custom button using
the `reject-trigger` slot.

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description:
Set this flag to show the modal, remove it to hide the modal.
Automatically updated when the user taps a trigger that opens or
closes the modal.

descriptor.name: openTrigger
descriptor.description:
Set to an HTMLElement reference using JavaScript. When the element
is clicked or tapped, the modal will be opened. To create your own
mechanism for opening the modal use the `opened` property and
do not set an `openTrigger`.

descriptor.name: disableCloseOnEscape
descriptor.description:
By default the user can press escape to dismiss the modal. Set this
property to `true` to disable that functionality if you want to
force the user to interact with the accept/reject buttons to
dismiss the modal.

descriptor.name: disableAutoFocus
descriptor.description:
By default the modal automatically focuses the first focusable
element in its slots or shadow root. To disable this behavior set
this property to `true`. Must be set before the modal is opened to
work correctly.

descriptor.name: fillContainer
descriptor.description:
By default, the modal will fit itself into the Window for use with
modal dialogs. Set this property to create a modal that fills another
container instead, for instance the main content area of your app.
You can specify which container using the `fitInto` property.

descriptor.name: fit
descriptor.description: Positions and fits the element into the `fitInto` element.

descriptor.name: resetFit
descriptor.description:
Resets the target element's position and size constraints, and clear
the memoized data.

descriptor.name: refit
descriptor.description:
Equivalent to calling `resetFit()` and `fit()`. Useful to call this after
the element or the `fitInto` element has been resized, or if any of the
positioning properties (e.g. `horizontalAlign, verticalAlign`) is updated.
It preserves the scroll position of the sizingTarget.

descriptor.name: position
descriptor.description: Positions the element according to `horizontalAlign, verticalAlign`.

descriptor.name: constrain
descriptor.description:
Constrains the size of the element to `fitInto` by setting `max-height`
and/or `max-width`.

descriptor.name: center
descriptor.description:
Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned. This also
sets `position:fixed`.

descriptor.name: findFocusableElements
descriptor.description:
Find focusable elements inside the modal by using `IronFocusablesHelper`'s
`getTabbableNodes()` helper method.
Call this method in case you are dymanically changing the modal's content
to update the array of focusable elements .

descriptor.name: containerType
descriptor.description: An optional type set on the px-overlay-container and px-overlay-content to associate specific overlay-contents with their container

descriptor.name: containerType
descriptor.description: An optional type set on the px-overlay-container and px-overlay-content to associate specific overlay-contents with their container

descriptor.name: eventNames
descriptor.description: A list of string event names that should get refired to this component from the container

descriptor.name: hoist
descriptor.description: Whether this component should hoist it's content to a container or leave it local.

descriptor.name: removeChild
descriptor.description: Removes a slotted child

descriptor.name: format
descriptor.description:
The format used to generate the output. Set to a [valid numbro.js
format string](http://numbrojs.com/format.html).

Set to "NONE" to skip formatting and use the `value` to set the
`formattedValue` directly.

descriptor.name: currency
descriptor.description: Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

descriptor.name: culture
descriptor.description: Provide localization for currency formatting

descriptor.name: zeroFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format for `0` value

descriptor.name: value
descriptor.description: The number value to be formatted

descriptor.name: formattedValue
descriptor.description:
The formatted string representation of the value. Only set if
`targetElement` is not defined

descriptor.name: negative
descriptor.description: Reflect if the value is negative

descriptor.name: unformat
descriptor.description: A formatted String to extract a value from

descriptor.name: unformattedValue
descriptor.description: The unformatted Number representation of the unformat value

descriptor.name: defaultFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format

descriptor.name: defaultCurrencyFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format for currency

descriptor.name: targetElement
descriptor.description:
Target element to assign the formatted value to. If defined
`formattedValue` won't be assigned

descriptor.name: format
descriptor.description:
The format used to generate the output. Set to a [valid numbro.js
format string](http://numbrojs.com/format.html).

Set to "NONE" to skip formatting and use the `value` to set the
`formattedValue` directly.

descriptor.name: currency
descriptor.description: Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

descriptor.name: culture
descriptor.description: Provide localization for currency formatting

descriptor.name: zeroFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format for `0` value

descriptor.name: value
descriptor.description: The number value to be formatted

descriptor.name: formattedValue
descriptor.description:
The formatted string representation of the value. Only set if
`targetElement` is not defined

descriptor.name: negative
descriptor.description: Reflect if the value is negative

descriptor.name: unformat
descriptor.description: A formatted String to extract a value from

descriptor.name: unformattedValue
descriptor.description: The unformatted Number representation of the unformat value

descriptor.name: defaultFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format

descriptor.name: defaultCurrencyFormat
descriptor.description: Provide a new default format for currency

descriptor.name: targetElement
descriptor.description:
Target element to assign the formatted value to. If defined
`formattedValue` won't be assigned

descriptor.name: keyEventTarget
descriptor.description: Used by iron-a11y-keys-behavior.

descriptor.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
descriptor.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

descriptor.name: keyBindings
descriptor.description: Used by iron-a11y-keys-behavior.

descriptor.name: position
descriptor.description: Where to place the panel - one of `top`, `bottom`, `left`, or `right`.

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description: Whether the panel is currently open (expanded).

descriptor.name: fixed
descriptor.description:
If set to true, the panel will have `position:fixed` so it will
be attached to the browser window instead of its parent container.

descriptor.name: persistent
descriptor.description:
If set to true, the panel will be opened and calls to the `close()` method will be ignored.
Mutating the `opened` property will still force a close of the panel.

descriptor.name: background
descriptor.description:
Whether to display the panel with a `light`, `medium`, or `dark` background.
These terms are relative, and can be used in conjunction with px-theme,
px-dark-theme, or your custom theme or CSS variables to toggle between 3 different
background colors.

descriptor.name: floating
descriptor.description:
If set to true, the panel will appear with an offset relative to the screen / container edges.
Can be overridden or customized using the CSS variables.

descriptor.name: minimizable
descriptor.description:
If set to true, the panel will not fully collapse when closed. It will appear in a minimized state.
You can use the content slot `minimized` to determine what will appear inside the panel while minimized
(likely an icon or button for fully opening the panel).

descriptor.name: notifyResize
descriptor.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

descriptor.name: assignParentResizable
descriptor.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

descriptor.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
descriptor.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

descriptor.name: resizerShouldNotify
descriptor.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: addOwnKeyBinding
descriptor.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

descriptor.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
descriptor.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

descriptor.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
descriptor.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

descriptor.name: open
descriptor.description: Opens the panel.

descriptor.name: close
descriptor.description: Closes the panel. Also called by iron-a11y-keys-behavior when a user presses the "Esc" key.

descriptor.name: val
descriptor.description: Value of the circle - percent is calculated using the maximum provided. Negative values result in 0% while values above maximum result in 100%.

descriptor.name: max
descriptor.description: The maximum allowed value. The filled portion is calculated based on value divided by maximum. If an invalid maximum is provided, defaults to 100.

descriptor.name: thickness
descriptor.description: The thickness, in pixels, of the donut ring. Will not go beyond 10% of the component's size to avoid display issues.

descriptor.name: for
descriptor.description:
The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip.

descriptor.name: orientation
descriptor.description:
The direction that the popover is displayed relative to the
`for` element.
- `left` - to the left of the 'for' element
- `right` - to the right of the 'for' element
- `top` - above the 'for' element
- `bottom` - below the 'for' element
- `auto` - will be placed wherever there is space available

descriptor.name: popoverTitle
descriptor.description: The title that will be displayed in the popover.

descriptor.name: popoverBody
descriptor.description: The body text that will be displayed in the popover. Note: Does not support HTML elements within the body. Set `enhanced` and pass HTML as a child of the px-popover instead.

descriptor.name: position
descriptor.description: Deprecated: this property is not actually used by the component anymore, but is retained for backward compatibility.

descriptor.name: showOverlay
descriptor.description:
By default, the overlay covering the rest of the screen is off.
This property should be set for mobile applications.

descriptor.name: enhanced
descriptor.description:
Enhanced empowers the developer to fully control the inner HTML of the popover. For instance, the popover can be used to render a form or contain an embedded video.
To inject your custom HTML, simply include your custom markup as the first child of the px-popover when declaring the px-popover in your application. Sample provided below.

    <px-popover for="someElement" enhanced>
        <form>
           <label>This is a form
             <input type='text'/>
           </label>
        </form>
    </px-popover>

descriptor.name: scrollAction
descriptor.description:
Determines behavior of the popover when scrolling occurs outside:
- `lock` - scrolling is disabled until popover is dismissed
- `cancel` - scrolling dismisses the popover

descriptor.name: show
descriptor.description: Displays the popover

descriptor.name: hide
descriptor.description: Hides the popover

descriptor.name: items
descriptor.description:
An array that contains the list of items which show up in the switcher.
Each item is an object consisting of:
* 'key' - a unique identifier (number or string)
* 'val' - the actual text that is displayed
* 'icon' - an icon name from the px-icon-set to display next to the item (optional)

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description: A flag which reflects if the product switcher trigger has been clicked or not.

descriptor.name: horizontalAlign
descriptor.description:
Horizontal alignment of the dropdown relative to the trigger.
Should be one of `left` or `right` where `left` means that the dropdown
and trigger are aligned on their left side, so the dropdown will extend _to the right_.

descriptor.name: verticalAlign
descriptor.description:
Vertical alignment of the dropdown relative to the trigger.
Should be one of `top` or `bottom` where `top` means that the dropdown
and trigger are aligned at the top, so the dropdown will extend _below_ the trigger.

descriptor.name: mobile
descriptor.description:
Whether the product switcher should display in a mobile configuration.
Automatically calculated based on the breakpoint in `mobileAt`.

descriptor.name: mobileAt
descriptor.description: Value (in pixels) at which to switch to the mobile configuration.

descriptor.name: icon
descriptor.description: Icon to be used as the invoking trigger element for the product switcher.

descriptor.name: selected
descriptor.description: Key of the item selected in the product switcher.

descriptor.name: toggle
descriptor.description: Opens the switcher when the trigger is pressed.

descriptor.name: keyEventTarget
descriptor.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

descriptor.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
descriptor.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

descriptor.name: keyBindings
descriptor.description:
To be used to express what combination of keys  will trigger the relative
callback. e.g. `keyBindings: { 'esc': '_onEscPressed'}`

descriptor.name: blockFutureDates
descriptor.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

descriptor.name: blockPastDates
descriptor.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow past dates to be selected (past dates will be disabled and unclickable).

descriptor.name: language
descriptor.description: set a default for localizing

descriptor.name: resources
formats
useKeyIfMissing
descriptor.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

descriptor.name: localize
descriptor.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

descriptor.name: bubbleEvent
descriptor.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

descriptor.name: timeZone
descriptor.description:
Moment-timezone string for using a specific timezone. See
http://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/data-loading/getting-zone-names/.

If not provided, tries to guess the current local timezone.

descriptor.name: minDate
descriptor.description: The minimum / earliest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates before this will be disabled and unclickable).

descriptor.name: maxDate
descriptor.description: The maximum / latest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates after this will be disabled and unclickable).

descriptor.name: fromMoment
descriptor.description: Moment object start date & time

descriptor.name: toMoment
descriptor.description: Moment object end date & time

descriptor.name: presetRanges
descriptor.description: The preset date/time ranges to be displayed.

descriptor.name: showButtons
descriptor.description: Whether to show Apply and Cancel buttons in the components

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description: Whether the panel is opened

descriptor.name: dateFormat
descriptor.description: Moment format used to format the date

descriptor.name: timeFormat
descriptor.description: Moment format used to format the time

descriptor.name: hideTime
descriptor.description: Whether to allow time selection as well in this date picker

descriptor.name: hidePresets
descriptor.description: Whether to show the preset date/time ranges

descriptor.name: hideIcon
descriptor.description: Controls whether the calendar/clock icon should be hidden

descriptor.name: allowWrap
descriptor.description: Whether to allow the range field to wrap at smaller screen resolutions / parent container sizes.

descriptor.name: showFieldTitles
descriptor.description:
This will remove the `to` inbetween the fields and
add titles above the fields. This allows for a
more flexable design.

descriptor.name: scrollAction
descriptor.description:
Controls if the page can be scrolled when the
panel is open.
Sets the `scrollAction` property on `iron-dropdown`

lock - blocks scrolling from happening
refit - computes the new position of the panel
cancel - causes the overlay to close

descriptor.name: isValid
descriptor.description: Whether the currently selected date is valid

descriptor.name: timeIsValid
descriptor.description: Whether the currently selected date is valid

descriptor.name: required
descriptor.description:
Boolean stating if the range field is required.
Will result in an error if left blank.

descriptor.name: hideValidationMessages
descriptor.description: Hides the validation messages if set to true

descriptor.name: showTimeZone
descriptor.description:
Timezone display format
- 'dropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which the user can select a different timezone. Contains only a subset of all timezones.
- 'extendedDropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which user can select a different timezone. Contains all existing timezones (588 total).
- 'text': shows the timezone as text, non-editable.
- 'abbreviatedText': shows the timezone as abbreviated text, non-editable (e.g. UTC, PST, EST).

descriptor.name: addOwnKeyBinding
descriptor.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

descriptor.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
descriptor.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

descriptor.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
descriptor.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

descriptor.name: keyEventTarget
descriptor.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

descriptor.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
descriptor.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

descriptor.name: keyBindings
descriptor.description: Key bindings for iron-a11y-keys-behavior

descriptor.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

descriptor.name: showFieldTitles
descriptor.description:
This will remove the `to` inbetween the fields and
add titles above the fields. This allows for a
more flexable design.

descriptor.name: fullWidth
descriptor.description:
For layout purposes.
This will display grid the fields. `showFieldTitles` must be true for styles to take effect.

`--px-datetime-range-field-column-min-width` (default: 250px) - controls
the min-width that each field is allowed to be before the grid wraps.

`--px-datetime-range-field-margin-between-fields` (default: 10px) - controls
the horizontal spacing between the fields.

This means each field will take up half of the container that `px-datetime-range-field`
is in, minus the space between the fields. When the container scales smaller than 510px or
`(--px-datetime-range-field-column-min-width * 2 + --px-datetime-range-field-margin-between-fields)`.

The fields will wrap under each other regardless of the `allow-wrap` prop in every browser except for IE.
Setting this property will override anything set in the `--px-datetime-range-field-justify-fields`

Controls if the page can be scrolled when the
panel is open.

lock - blocks scrolling from happening
refit - computes the new position of the panel
cancel - causes the overlay to close

descriptor.name: value
descriptor.description: Represents the value (from 0 to 100) of the percentage progress.

descriptor.name: infinite
descriptor.description:
Flag for whether to animate the progress bar. Set to true for an
indeterminate or infinite progress bar.

descriptor.name: min
descriptor.description:
The minimum value for the progress bar, used to calculate the amount
that is filled in.

descriptor.name: max
descriptor.description:
The maximum value for the progress bar, used to calculate the amount
that is filled in.

descriptor.name: moduleName
descriptor.description: Name of the Sass module.

descriptor.name: moduleDescription
descriptor.description: Description of the Sass module.

descriptor.name: attributeChangedCallback
descriptor.description:
Implements native Custom Elements `attributeChangedCallback` to
set an attribute value to a property via `_attributeToProperty`.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of attribute that changed

params.name: old
params.description: Old attribute value

params.name: value
params.description: New attribute value

descriptor.name: setProperties
descriptor.description:
Sets a bag of property changes to this instance, and
synchronously processes all effects of the properties as a batch.

Property names must be simple properties, not paths.  Batched
path propagation is not supported.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of one or more key-value pairs whose key is
  a property and value is the new value to set for that property.

params.name: setReadOnly
params.description:
When true, any private values set in
  `props` will be set. By default, `setProperties` will not set
  `readOnly: true` root properties.

descriptor.name: linkPaths
descriptor.description:
Aliases one data path as another, such that path notifications from one
are routed to the other.

params.name: to
params.description: Target path to link.

params.name: from
params.description: Source path to link.

descriptor.name: unlinkPaths
descriptor.description:
Removes a data path alias previously established with `_linkPaths`.

Note, the path to unlink should be the target (`to`) used when
linking the paths.

params.name: path
params.description: Target path to unlink.

descriptor.name: notifySplices

params.name: path
params.description: Path that should be notified.

params.name: splices
params.description:
Array of splice records indicating ordered
  changes that occurred to the array. Each record should have the
  following fields:
   * index: index at which the change occurred
   * removed: array of items that were removed from this index
   * addedCount: number of new items added at this index
   * object: a reference to the array in question
   * type: the string literal 'splice'

  Note that splice records _must_ be normalized such that they are
  reported in index order (raw results from `Object.observe` are not
  ordered and must be normalized/merged before notifying).

descriptor.name: get
descriptor.description:
Convenience method for reading a value from a path.

Note, if any part in the path is undefined, this method returns
`undefined` (this method does not throw when dereferencing undefined
paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to read.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `foo.bar.baz`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `users.12.name` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: root
params.description: Root object from which the path is evaluated.

return.desc:
Value at the path, or `undefined` if any part of the path
  is undefined.

descriptor.name: set
descriptor.description:
Convenience method for setting a value to a path and notifying any
elements bound to the same path.

Note, if any part in the path except for the last is undefined,
this method does nothing (this method does not throw when
dereferencing undefined paths).

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the value
  to write.  The path may be specified as a string (e.g. `'foo.bar.baz'`)
  or an array of path parts (e.g. `['foo.bar', 'baz']`).  Note that
  bracketed expressions are not supported; string-based path parts
  *must* be separated by dots.  Note that when dereferencing array
  indices, the index may be used as a dotted part directly
  (e.g. `'users.12.name'` or `['users', 12, 'name']`).

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set at the specified path.

params.name: root
params.description:
Root object from which the path is evaluated.
  When specified, no notification will occur.

descriptor.name: push
descriptor.description:
Adds items onto the end of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

params.name: items
params.description: Items to push onto array

descriptor.name: pop
descriptor.description:
Removes an item from the end of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

descriptor.name: splice
descriptor.description:
Starting from the start index specified, removes 0 or more items
from the array and inserts 0 or more new items in their place.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.splice`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

params.name: start
params.description: Index from which to start removing/inserting.

params.name: deleteCount
params.description: Number of items to remove.

params.name: items
params.description: Items to insert into array.

descriptor.name: shift
descriptor.description:
Removes an item from the beginning of array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.pop`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

descriptor.name: unshift
descriptor.description:
Adds items onto the beginning of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

params.name: items
params.description: Items to insert info array

descriptor.name: notifyPath

params.name: path
params.description: Path that should be notified.

params.name: value
params.description: Value at the path (optional).

descriptor.name: connectedCallback
descriptor.description:
Provides a default implementation of the standard Custom Elements
`connectedCallback`.

The default implementation enables the property effects system and
flushes any pending properties, and updates shimmed CSS properties
when using the ShadyCSS scoping/custom properties polyfill.

descriptor.name: disconnectedCallback
descriptor.description: Called when the element is removed from a document

descriptor.name: updateStyles
descriptor.description:
When using the ShadyCSS scoping and custom property shim, causes all
shimmed styles in this element (and its subtree) to be updated
based on current custom property values.

The optional parameter overrides inline custom property styles with an
object of properties where the keys are CSS properties, and the values
are strings.

Example: `this.updateStyles({'--color': 'blue'})`

These properties are retained unless a value of `null` is set.

Note: This function does not support updating CSS mixins.
You can not dynamically change the value of an `@apply`.

params.name: properties
params.description:
Bag of custom property key/values to
  apply to this element.

descriptor.name: resolveUrl
descriptor.description:
Rewrites a given URL relative to a base URL. The base URL defaults to
the original location of the document containing the `dom-module` for
this element. This method will return the same URL before and after
bundling.

Note that this function performs no resolution for URLs that start
with `/` (absolute URLs) or `#` (hash identifiers).  For general purpose
URL resolution, use `window.URL`.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to resolve.

params.name: base
params.description:
Optional base URL to resolve against, defaults
to the element's `importPath`

descriptor.name: optionName
descriptor.description: Name of the option.

descriptor.name: chooseWith
descriptor.description:
Type of form element used to set the option.
Choose from: 'dropdown', 'boolean'

descriptor.name: choices
descriptor.description: Choices that can be set for this option.

descriptor.name: defaultChoice
descriptor.description: Default choice to set for this option when first attached.

descriptor.name: selectedChoice
descriptor.description: Current selected choice.

descriptor.description:
When using the ShadyCSS scoping and custom property shim, causes all
shimmed styles in this element (and its subtree) to be updated
based on current custom property values.

object of properties where the keys are CSS properties, and the values
are strings.

descriptor.name: resolveUrl
descriptor.description:

the original location of the document containing the `dom-module` for
this element. This method will return the same URL before and after
bundling.

Note that this function performs no resolution for URLs that start
with `/` (absolute URLs) or `#` (hash identifiers).  For general purpose
URL resolution, use `window.URL`.

params.description:

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

Adds items onto the beginning of the array at the path specified.

The arguments after `path` and return value match that of
`Array.prototype.push`.

This method notifies other paths to the same array that a
splice occurred to the array.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to array.

params.name: items
params.description: Items to insert info array

descriptor.name: notifyPath

params.name: path
params.description: Path that should be notified.

descriptor.name: connectedCallback
descriptor.description:
Provides a default implementation of the standard Custom Elements
`connectedCallback`.

The default implementation enables the property effects system and
flushes any pending properties, and updates shimmed CSS properties
when using the ShadyCSS scoping/custom properties polyfill.

descriptor.name: disconnectedCallback
descriptor.description: Called when the element is removed from a document

descriptor.name: updateStyles
descriptor.description:
When using the ShadyCSS scoping and custom property shim, causes all
shimmed styles in this element (and its subtree) to be updated
based on current custom property values.

The optional parameter overrides inline custom property styles with an
object of properties where the keys are CSS properties, and the values
are strings.

Example: `this.updateStyles({'--color': 'blue'})`

These properties are retained unless a value of `null` is set.

Note: This function does not support updating CSS mixins.
You can not dynamically change the value of an `@apply`.

params.name: properties
params.description:
Bag of custom property key/values to
  apply to this element.

descriptor.name: resolveUrl
descriptor.description:
Rewrites a given URL relative to a base URL. The base URL defaults to
the original location of the document containing the `dom-module` for
this element. This method will return the same URL before and after
bundling.

Note that this function performs no resolution for URLs that start
with `/` (absolute URLs) or `#` (hash identifiers).  For general purpose
URL resolution, use `window.URL`.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to resolve.

params.name: base
params.description:
Optional base URL to resolve against, defaults
to the element's `importPath`

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: chartData
descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: x
descriptor.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: y
descriptor.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

descriptor.name: dataExtents
svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
descriptor.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

Configuration object used to customize the tooltip cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip and px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

descriptor.name: registerConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: preventResize
descriptor.description: Prevents the chart from automatically resizing to fit its container

descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: chartVerticalAlignment
descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- top
- bottom

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

Timing (in ms) to be used for iron resize when the chart auto size
(preventResize = false)

descriptor.description: Array of the svg layers

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: defaultSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

descriptor.name: includeAllSeries
descriptor.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: clone

This attribute configures custom bar colors. Pass in the desired

settings the colors as CSS style variables to fit in with
other theming capabilities. Setting the colors attribute directly
will override all default colors and any CSS style variable themes.

descriptor.name: legendLabels
descriptor.description:
This attribute defines the custom text labels for your bar chart
legend. Pass in the values as an array of strings.
descriptor.defaultValue: ["Bar One","Bar Two","Bar Three","Bar Four","Bar Five","Bar Six","Bar Seven","Bar Eight","Bar Nine","Bar Ten","Bar Eleven","Bar Twelve","Bar Thirteen","Bar Fourteen","Bar Fifteen"]

descriptor.name: colors
descriptor.description:
This attribute configures custom bar colors. Pass in the desired
values as an array of hexadecimal value color strings. Prefer
settings the colors as CSS style variables to fit in with
other theming capabilities. Setting the colors attribute directly
will override all default colors and any CSS style variable themes.


Example setting colors as an attribute:

```
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart
      ...
      colors=['#5da5da', '#faa43a', '#60bd68']>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

Example setting colors with CSS style variables:

```
  <style>
    :root {
      --px-vis-series-color-0: #5da5da;
      --px-vis-series-color-1: #faa43a;
      --px-vis-series-color-2: #60bd68;
    }
  </style>
  <px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart ...>
  </px-simple-horizontal-bar-chart>
```

If you want to use an attribute value or property of an element for

look up the property of a selectable element. Camel cased values are

recommended that you provide the hyphenated form of the name so that
selection works in both cases. (Use `attr-or-property-name` instead of
`attrOrPropertyName`.)

is not found.

Force a synchronous update of the `items` property.

NOTE: Consider listening for the `iron-items-changed` event to respond to

WARNING: If you are using this method, you should probably consider an
alternate approach. Synchronously querying for items is potentially

on its own to reflect selectable items in the DOM.

An array of steps and their details. If empty, the component is not rendered.

     [{ id: String, label: String }, ... ]

An array of IDs corresponding to items in the steps array which

descriptor.name: config
descriptor.description:
Configuration for the tresholds.
The value should be an array of Objects with the following structure:

    {
      "min": {Number} beginning of the threshold,
      "max": {Number} end of the threshold,
      "color": {Hex / RGB} background color for the threshold
    }

Negative values are supported, but all thresholds should be contiguous
(e.g. the max of one should be the min of the next one, with no gaps).
If thresholds are defined so narrowly that the tick label will not fit
inside the treshold, display issues may occur.

If this property is null a value won't be shown but the threshold bar will still be displayed.

The unit of measure for the value, if any. You should use one or two characters at most,
as longer values for UOM may cause display issues.
