descriptor.name: required
descriptor.description:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.

descriptor.name: validator
descriptor.description: Name of the validator to use.

descriptor.name: invalid
descriptor.description: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

descriptor.name: checked
descriptor.description: Gets or sets the state, `true` is checked and `false` is unchecked.

descriptor.name: toggles
descriptor.description:
If true, the button toggles the active state with each tap or press
of the spacebar.

descriptor.name: validate

params.name: value
params.description:
Deprecated: The value to be validated. By default,
it is passed to the validator's `validate()` function, if a validator is set.
If this argument is not specified, then the element's `value` property
is used, if it exists.

descriptor.name: for
descriptor.description:
Either the id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to or the element itself.

If an ID is passed, this element must be a sibling of the tooltip.
If an element, location in the dom does not matter.

(Optional)  If not provided, the px-tooltip will be attached to its parent element.

descriptor.name: delay
descriptor.description:
The amount of time in miliseconds before the tooltip should appear when the
target element is hovered over.

descriptor.name: orientation
descriptor.description:
The direction that the tooltip is displayed relative to the
'for' element.
- 'auto' calculated at render time or resize
- 'left' to the left of the 'for' element
- 'right' to the right of the 'for' element
- 'top' above the 'for' element
- 'bottom' below the 'for' element

descriptor.name: tooltipMessage
descriptor.description: The string to be displayed in the tooltip message.

descriptor.name: opened
descriptor.description:
This boolean can be used to REQUEST an open/close action to the tooltip
Because the show/hide mechanism are asynchronous this won't represent
the actual presence of the tooltip on the screen, this is represented
by the `visible` property

descriptor.name: visible
descriptor.description: Whether the tooltip is currently shown on screen

descriptor.name: ignoreTargetEvents
descriptor.description:
If true the tooltip will ignore the targets events it usually listens
to: mouseup/down, mouseleave/enter... Use this to more precisely
manually control the showing/hiding of the tooltip

descriptor.name: openRequested
descriptor.description:
True when opened has been requested (i.e set to true) but the tooltip
hasn't been made visible yet. Not needed in most cases but might be
helpful to catch edge states (i.e reclosing the tooltip after a show
request has been issued but the tooltip isn't visible yet)

descriptor.name: smartOrientation
descriptor.description:
If smartOrientation is turned on then the tooltip will override the
default orientation to try to better fit on the page. Smart Orientation
will be chosen in a clockwise manner. (Example: for a tooltip with
"right" orientation it will be below if tooltip will go off right side
of the screen, but left if it goes off right *and* bottom side of the
screen).
Note: this feature is only enabled for the "top" or "bottom" orientations

descriptor.name: mouseCoords
descriptor.description: If using followMouse the mouse coordinates to display the tooltip at, *in viewport pixels*

descriptor.name: watchDogTimeout
descriptor.description:
When shown the tooltip uses a watchdog to ensure it is removed
if the parent is removed. The watchdog runs every watchDogTimeout ms
If you see a performance degradation when showing tooltip you can
increase the watchdog timeout

descriptor.name: notifyResize
descriptor.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

descriptor.name: assignParentResizable
descriptor.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

descriptor.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
descriptor.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

descriptor.name: resizerShouldNotify
descriptor.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: listenEvents
descriptor.description:
Starts listening to all mouse events (on the target(s)) we are
interested in: mouseenter, mouseup, mouseleave, mousedown

descriptor.name: unlistenEvents
descriptor.description:
Stops listening to all mouse events (on the target(s)) we were interested
in: mouseenter, mouseup, mouseleave, mousedown

descriptor.name: setPosition
descriptor.description:
This function calls the appropriate positioning function,
according to the orientation specified, target and tooltip content

descriptor.name: resources
descriptor.defaultValue: {"en":{"TODAY":"TODAY","THIS WEEK":"THIS WEEK","THIS MONTH":"THIS MONTH","THIS YEAR":"THIS YEAR","LAST YEAR":"LAST YEAR"}}

descriptor.name: formats
localize
descriptor.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

descriptor.name: bubbleEvent
descriptor.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

descriptor.name: language
descriptor.description:
A valid IETF language tag as a string that `app-localize-behavior` will
use to localize this component.

See https://github.com/PolymerElements/app-localize-behavior for API
documentation and more information.

descriptor.name: resources
descriptor.description:
Dictionary of strings used in this component.
You should provide localizations for whichever `language`
you plan to use.
descriptor.defaultValue: {"en":{"TODAY":"TODAY","THIS WEEK":"THIS WEEK","THIS MONTH":"THIS MONTH","THIS YEAR":"THIS YEAR","LAST YEAR":"LAST YEAR"}}

descriptor.name: formats
useKeyIfMissing
descriptor.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

descriptor.name: localize
descriptor.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

descriptor.name: bubbleEvent
descriptor.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

descriptor.name: timelineData
descriptor.description:
Data for the timeline.
Expected format is an array of objects, see above for further details.
Each object in the array represents a timeline node entry.
Timeline data is expected to be sorted before passing to the px-timeline component.

descriptor.name: showTimeGroups
descriptor.description: Whether to group the timeline node entries by generic time groups. Time groups are Today, This Week, This Month, This Year and Last Year.

descriptor.name: enhanced
descriptor.description:
Whether to create a basic or enhanced timeline. The default, basic timeline only includes text content, whereas an enhanced
timeline can display rich media content in expandable/collapsible nodes.

descriptor.name: showNodeContent
descriptor.description:
Set this flag to expand all nodes within the timeline, either by default or dynamically.
Note: only applies to `enhanced` timelines.

descriptor.name: dateFormat
descriptor.description:
Valid date string to be used by Moment.js for formatting of the date and time displayed in the timeline.
See [https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more information.

descriptor.name: compactEditorInfo
descriptor.description:
When a node has editor info, whether to display the name next
to the date (compact) or in the details (not compact).
Note: only applies to `enhanced` timelines.

descriptor.name: timeZone
descriptor.description:
Moment-timezone string for using a specific timezone. See
http://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/data-loading/getting-zone-names/.

If not provided, tries to guess the current local timezone.

descriptor.name: editable
descriptor.description:
Whether the timeline node titles should be editable.
When set and a user invokes the edit mode, the `px-timeline-edit` event
is fired, which you should handle accordingly to update `timelineData`.

descriptor.name: disabled
descriptor.description: Sets disabled on the input element.

descriptor.name: placeholder
descriptor.description: The placeholder for the input element.

descriptor.name: localCandidates
descriptor.description: The search candidates from local data model.

descriptor.name: prefetchUrl
descriptor.description:
Url for a pre-fetched list in json format for the list of suggestion candidates.
The response should be an array - for example: ["a","b"]

descriptor.name: maxSuggestions
descriptor.description: Maximum number of suggestions for remote urls

descriptor.name: remoteUrl
descriptor.description: Remote url to perform a search using the value in the input. The input value will be passed in as url parameter. The placeholder should be %QUERY.

descriptor.name: remoteUrlSearching
descriptor.description:
A boolean property to indicate if a search happens with a remote Url.
Must be used together with remoteUrl.

descriptor.name: value
descriptor.description: The currently selected value of the input.

descriptor.name: inputValue
descriptor.description: The current value of the input while the user is searching.

descriptor.name: required
descriptor.description: Whether the typeahead is required to be filled in before proceeding.

descriptor.name: notifyResize
descriptor.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

descriptor.name: assignParentResizable
descriptor.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

descriptor.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
descriptor.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

descriptor.name: resizerShouldNotify
descriptor.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: import
descriptor.description:
The URL pointing to the validation function(s) to be imported for this validator.
See px-example-validator.html for an example of this.

    <px-validator import="px-example-validator.html"></px-validator>

descriptor.name: validators
descriptor.description: Array container that stores the validation function(s) imported from the html import (specified in the `import` property).

descriptor.name: multiStepValidation
descriptor.description:
Array containing the validation function names the developer wants to run against the value they wish to validate.
Should EITHER specify validation-method (for single) or multi-step-validation (for multiple).

    <px-validator multi-step-validation='["isNumber", "isRed", "isBlue"]' import="px-example-validator.html"></px-validator>

descriptor.name: validationMethod
descriptor.description:
String containing the single validation function name the developer wants to run to validate the supplied test value.
Should EITHER specify validation-method (for single) or multi-step-validation (for multiple).

    <px-validator validation-method='isNumber' import="px-example-validator.html"></px-validator>

descriptor.name: arguments
descriptor.description:
Additional arguments to pass in to the validation method. For cases like px-data-table where the `validate` method
is fired automatically instead of programmatically by the developer.

descriptor.name: validate
descriptor.description:
This method loops through each validator and validates the content.
All parameters passed to this method are in turn passed
on to the function specified in `validation-method` or `multi-step-validation`
of px-validator.

descriptor.name: title
descriptor.description: The title displayed in the center of the header.

descriptor.name: subtitle
descriptor.description: The (optional) subtitle displayed in the center of the header.

descriptor.name: useDeckSelector
descriptor.description:
Whether the deck selector will be passed in between the opening and closing tags of px-view-header.
If true, title and subtitle are ignored.

descriptor.name: disableBranchSelect
descriptor.description:
When set to true, branches (nodes with children) can be expanded/collapsed,
but not selected. Only leaves (nodes with no children) will be selectable.

descriptor.name: label
descriptor.description:
Label to display in the body of the node.
Pulled from the `item` object for this node.

descriptor.name: canOpen
descriptor.description:
Whether or not the node can be expanded to display children.
Calculated from the `item` object for this node.

descriptor.name: item
descriptor.description:
An object reference for the item associated with the node.
Passed down recursively from the parent px-tree or parent px-tree-node.

descriptor.name: items
descriptor.description:
The array of child items associated with this px-tree-node.
Pulled from the `item` object for this node.

descriptor.name: isActive
descriptor.description:
Whether or not the node is currently expanded (activated).
Calculated from the activated logic of the overall tree.

descriptor.name: isSelected
descriptor.description:
Whether or not the node is currently selected.
Calculated from the selected logic of the overall tree.

descriptor.name: keys
descriptor.description:
Changes the item properties (keys) that will be used
internally to find each item's unique id, label, children list, and icon.
Passed down recursively from the parent px-tree or parent px-tree-node.

descriptor.name: multiSelect
descriptor.description:
Whether or not multiple nodes can be selected at a time.
Passed down recursively from the parent px-tree or parent px-tree-node.

descriptor.name: multiActivate
descriptor.description:
Whether or not multiple nodes can be expanded (activated) at a time.
Passed down recursively from the parent px-tree or parent px-tree-node.

descriptor.name: icon
descriptor.description:
The icon to display next to this particular node in the tree.
Scraped from the `item` object for this node.

descriptor.name: childrenUpdated
descriptor.description:
Internal boolean that is flipped when children are updated in the asset
graph, triggering data binding to show them in the tree.

descriptor.name: items
descriptor.description:
An array of objects that will be used to build the nav. Top-level items
can optionally have one level of children beneath them, turning the
top-level item into a dropdown group.

Selecting an item automatically selects its parent if it has one.
For the navigation, top-level items with children cannot be selected
directly - instead, users can select a child item and its parent will
also be marked as selected (and set as the `selectedItemParent`).

All items should have at least the following properties:

- {String} id - A unique string that identifies the item. Should only
contain valid ASCII characters. It's recommended to only use URI-safe
characters to allow for easy binding to the URL. Examples: 'home' or 'alerts'
- {String} label - A short, human-readable text label for the item.

The following optional properties can be used:

- {Array} children - An array of subitem objects that are children of
the item. Each child item should also have an `id` and `label`, and
may have its own child items.
- {Boolean=false} isTerminal - If `true` the item cannot have any children.
Terminal items can only be selected, not activated (navigated into).
Items with children should not be marked as terminal.
- {Boolean=false} isExhausted - If `true` the item does not have any
additional children available to load from a remote data source.
- {Boolean=true} isSelectable - If `false` the item can only be activated
(navigated into) to view its children, not selected.

The following is an example of a list of valid nav items:

    [
      { "label" : "Home",   "id" : "home" },
      { "label" : "Alerts", "id" : "alerts" },
      { "label" : "Assets", "id" : "assets", "children": [
        { "label" : "Asset #1", "id" : "a1" },
        { "label" : "Asset #2", "id" : "a2" }
      ] }
    ]

The item property names can be changed, e.g. to choose a different item
property to serve as a unique ID. See the `keys` property for details.

descriptor.name: keys
descriptor.description:
Changes the item properties (keys) that will be used internally to find
each item's unique ID, label, and child list.

Use this property if you already have a predefined data schema for your
application and want to customize this component to match your schema.
Otherwise, it's recommended to leave the defaults.

The following properties can be set:

- id: [default='id'] a unique ID for the item
- label: [default='label'] a human-readable label
- children: [default='children'] an array of child items

If you want to configure any keys, you must set all the keys. If any
of the keys are not defined, the navigation will fail.

For example, the schema could be changed to the following:

    {
      "id" : "assetId",
      "label" : "assetName",
      "children" : "subAssets"
    }

descriptor.name: selected
descriptor.description:
A reference to the currently selected item. Use this property to set the
selected item directly. The object passed to this property must be a
direct reference to one of the `items` objects. Changing this property
will automatically update the `selectedRoute`.

See `selectedRoute` for an alternative way to select items.

descriptor.name: selectedRoute
descriptor.description:
The route to the selected item as an array of strings. Use this property
to set the selected item by route, or to bind to updates when the
selected item is changed. Changing this property will automatically
update the `selected` item.

The route array starts at the top of the graph and ends with the selected
item. Each route entry is a string that corresponds to the unique ID
of an item. The item property that this unique ID will be taken from can be
configured with the `key` property. By default, it will be `item.id`.


For example, given the following graph:

    [
      {
        "label" : "Dashboards",
        "id" : "dash",
        "children" : [
          { "label" : "Truck Statuses", "id" : "trucks" },
          { "label" : "Generator Alerts", "id" : "generators" }
        ]
      },
    ]

To select the "Truck Statuses" page, set the route array to:

    ["dash", "trucks"]

If the user then selects the "Generator Alerts" item, the route array
would be replaced with a new array with the following entries:

    ["dash", "generators"]

descriptor.name: selectedMeta
descriptor.description:
[Read-only] Helpful metadata about the selected item.

SINGLE-SELECT MODE: An object with the following information about
the selected item (if no selected item, all values will be null):

- {Object} `item`: Reference to the selected item
- {Array} `path`: The path to the selected item as an array. Begins with
the top-most item in the graph and ends with the selected item. It
the selected item is at the top of the graph, the array will include
only the selected item.
- {Array} `route`: Route to the selected item (see `selectedRoute`
for more information on how this is created)
- {Object} `parent`: Reference to the selected item's parent,
or `null` if it has no parent
- {Array} `children`: Reference to the selected item's children,
or empty array if it has no children
- {Array} `siblings`: Reference to the selected item's siblings (e.g.
the children of its parent) or an array with only the selected item
if it has no children.

MUTLI-SELECT MODE: An array of objects with metadata about each
selected item. Each object will be contain the same values as above.
If no items are selected, all values will be null.

descriptor.name: activeMeta
descriptor.description:
[Read-only] Helpful metadata about the active item.

SINGLE-ACTIVE MODE: An object with the following information about
the active item (if no active item, all values will be null):

- {Object} `item`: Reference to the active item
- {Array} `path`: The path to the active item as an array. Begins with
the top-most item in the graph and ends with the active item. If
the active item is at the top of the graph, the array will include
only the active item.
- {Array} `route`: Route to the active item (see `activeRoute`
for more information on how this is created)
- {Object} `parent`: Reference to the active item's parent,
or `null` if it has no parent
- {Array} `children`: Reference to the active item's children,
or empty array if it has no children
- {Array} `siblings`: Reference to the active item's siblings (e.g.
the children of its parent) or an array with only the active item
if it has no children.

MULTI-ACTIVE MODE: An array of objects with metadata about each
active item. Each object will contain the same values as above.
If no items are active, all values will be null.

descriptor.name: disableBranchSelect
descriptor.description:
If set to true, branches (nodes with children) will not be selectable.
Clicking on a branch will still cause it to become active (expand), but it
will not be added to the selected property.

descriptor.name: multiSelect
descriptor.description:
If set to true, multiple nodes can be selected at the same time in the tree
by using the shift key (for selecting a range) or the ctrl/cmd key (for selecting individual nodes).

descriptor.name: multiActivate
descriptor.description:
If set to true, multiple nodes can be activated (expanded) at the same time.
If set to false, expanding a node will cause other nodes to automatically collapse.

descriptor.name: addChildren
descriptor.description:
Adds a child or children to the requested node. Pass a single object
to add one child, or an array of objects to add multiple children.

The `node` should be a direct reference to one of the objects already
in the asset graph (e.g. one of the `items` objects or another node
added through the `addChildren` API). To remove children from the root
of the graph, call with `node` as null.

descriptor.name: removeChildren
descriptor.description:
Removes a child or children from the requested node. Pass `children` a
single object to remove one child, an array of objects to remove multiple
children, or null to remove all children.

The `node` should be a direct reference to one of the objects already
in the asset graph (e.g. one of the `items` objects or another node
added through the `addChildren` API). To add children to the root
of the graph, call with `node` as null.

descriptor.name: select
descriptor.description:
Selects an item. Call with an object that is a direct reference to one
of the `items` objects.

If multi-select mode is enabled, call with an object to select a single
item or an array of objects to select multiple items.

An optional source of the change can be provided as a string.

descriptor.name: deselect
descriptor.description:
Deselects an item. Call with a direct reference to the selected item
or with `null` to deselect whatever is selected.

If multi-select mode is enabled, call with a direct reference to one of
the selected items to deselect it, or an array of selected items to
deselect multiple, or `null` to deselect all items.

descriptor.name: activate
descriptor.description:
Activates an item. Call with an object that is a direct reference to one
of the `items` objects.

If multi-activate mode is enabled, call with an object to activate a single
item or an array of objects to activate multiple items.

An optional source of the change can be provided as a string.

descriptor.name: deactivate
descriptor.description:
Deactivates an item. Call with a direct reference to the active item
or with `null` to deactivate whatever is active.

If multi-activate mode is enabled, call with a direct reference to one of
the active items to deactivate it, or an array of active items to
deactivate multiple, or `null` to deactivate all items.

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: chartData
descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
descriptor.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

descriptor.name: extentsData
extentsAction
descriptor.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

descriptor.name: selectionType
descriptor.description:
The zoom selection type:
- xy
- xAxis
- yAxis

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

descriptor.name: dataExtents
svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: x
descriptor.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: y
descriptor.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.name: seriesColorList
descriptor.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: defaultSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

descriptor.name: includeAllSeries
descriptor.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: xAxisConfig

Configuration object used to customize the X axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: yAxisConfig

descriptor.name: chartHorizontalAlignment

This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: chartVerticalAlignment

drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:

- top

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: thresholdConfig

descriptor.name: dynamicMenuConfig
offset

descriptor.name: disableDynamicUpdate

descriptor.name: chartId

descriptor.name: scalePadding
descriptor.description:
The padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between ordinal groups

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

descriptor.name: paddingOuter
descriptor.description:
The outer padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between the first and last ordinal group the the axes

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

descriptor.name: logBase

descriptor.name: actionConfig

Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found as a key in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

descriptor.name: zoomStack

descriptor.name: zoomInPercentage

The higher the number the more it will zoom in. should be less than 1.

descriptor.name: zoomOutPercentage
descriptor.description:
Percentage used to calculate new extents when using zoomOut feature.
The higher the number the more it will zoom out. should be less than 1.

descriptor.name: toolbarSubConfig

toolbarSubConfig can be passed around from a toolbar to another so that clicking
on a "global" toolbar drives the sub row state for other toolbars

Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

descriptor.name: annotationData
referenceData

descriptor.description:
A configuration object needed to draw reference curves. Format is similar to seriesConfig. Valid entries:
- `x` : default: 'x'
- `y`: default: 'y'
- `interpolationFunction` : default: Px.d3.curveCardinal
- `color` :
- `strokeWidth` default: 1

descriptor.name: firstDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: secondDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: separator
descriptor.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

descriptor.name: timezone
descriptor.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

descriptor.name: tooltipRequested
descriptor.description: Whether the tooltip should be shown or hidden

descriptor.name: tooltipOrientation
descriptor.description: Specifies the orientation of the event tooltip.

descriptor.description:

Bar charts in nearly all cases should start from 0. If you have a special case and understand the ramifications, change this to false to allow it to use the `min` value from your data

```
}
```

descriptor.name: muteUnmuteSeries
descriptor.description: Method to mute or umute

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.description:
Takes a graphic "snapshot" of the component and pass results through a callback:
- a canvas containing the graphical snapshot
- a png base 64 data uri

callback object:
{
 canvas: theCanvasObject
 image: "data:image/png;base64;iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACN..."
}

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do
further processing, such as combining different elements snapshot into one image

Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable

should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element

A candidate descendant element that

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.

- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```


 }

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

 image: "data:image/png;base64;iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACN..."
}

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do
further processing, such as combining different elements snapshot into one image

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: defaultSeriesConfig

This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: syncCSSTheme
descriptor.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

descriptor.name: getPixelFromData
descriptor.description:
Gets pixel values for data values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). data is an array: [xValue, yValue]
if margin is specified it will use thos to adjust the pixel values
instead of the normal `margin` property
returns an object with the result and whether that result is out of
bounds for the current domain

descriptor.name: getDataFromPixel
descriptor.description:
Gets data values for pixel values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). pixelVal is an array: [xValue, yValue]
please note that the values returned have no guarantee to match any
actual chart data, this is just a conversion based on pixel

descriptor.name: undoZoom

descriptor.description: Method that takes a datetime string, timezone string, and a formatting string. Returns a formated datetime string.

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
descriptor.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

descriptor.name: extentsData
extentsAction
descriptor.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

descriptor.name: dataExtents
svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: x
descriptor.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: y
descriptor.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: offset
descriptor.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

descriptor.name: selectedDomain
descriptor.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: disableDynamicUpdate
descriptor.description: Defines if the viewable chart extents should update when chartData is updated

descriptor.name: chartId
descriptor.description: Internal unique ID

descriptor.name: scalePadding
descriptor.description:
The padding for ordinal type scales - effective controls the spacing between ordinal groups

Expressed as a percent of the ordinal group width, so a value of 0.5 for a bar chart means your bar and the gap between bars are the same size

descriptor.name: logBase
descriptor.description: The base for logarithmic type scales

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.description:
Data representing the events. Example:
```
[
     { "for":"y0", "type":"max", "value":35.4784 },

     { "for":"y0", "type":"mean", "value":15.330657585139331 },

     { "for":"", "type":"quartile", "value":17 }
 ]
```

Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:

descriptor.name: annotationData
firstDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: secondDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: separator
descriptor.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

descriptor.name: timezone
descriptor.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series data keys, name, type, and colors.

Provide two series, one for the left, one for the right.

```
 {
    "left": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "male",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "y": "age",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "People" //Unit to be used for the X axis.
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,255,0)" //color you want for the series
    },
    "right": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "female",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "y": "age",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "People" //Unit to be used for the X axis.
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(255,0,0)" //color you want for the series
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: startFromZero
descriptor.description:
DO NOT CHANGE THIS UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING

Bar charts in nearly all cases should start from 0. If you have a special case and understand the ramifications, change this to false to allow it to use the `min` value from your data

descriptor.name: rightReferenceConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration object needed to draw reference curves. Format is similar to seriesConfig. Valid entries:
- `x` : default: 'x'
- `y`: default: 'y'
- `interpolationFunction` : default: Px.d3.curveCardinal
- `color` :
- `strokeWidth` default: 1

descriptor.name: leftReferenceConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration object needed to draw reference curves. Format is similar to seriesConfig. Valid entries:
- `x` : default: 'x'
- `y`: default: 'y'
- `interpolationFunction` : default: Px.d3.curveCardinal
- `color` :
- `strokeWidth` default: 1

descriptor.name: referenceData
descriptor.description: Data to create reference curves. Format matches chartData and requires a referenceConfig with similar props to seriesConfig. Supply data for both left and right in this array

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do

An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents

descriptor.name: seriesKey
descriptor.description:
A `Required` dev set string which defines which data key to use for the series lines

 This depends on your data and could be *x*, *Timestamp*, ect.

descriptor.name: selectedDomain
descriptor.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: chartExtents
descriptor.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
Setting this and not using "dynamic" will prevent the chart from
having to parse the data to find the extents and therefore improve
performance for initial rendering
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynamic"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

descriptor.name: debounceOnPanning
descriptor.description:
Whether the drawings will be debounced on panning the chart.
When not debounced the redraw will happen more often on panning,
which should result in a smoother experience. However if rendering
a big number of points this can have the opposite effect since
it wil redraw too often comapred tot he time taken to re render everything

descriptor.name: rendererMinimumPointsPerFrame
descriptor.description:
The minimum number of points to render per frame
even if the chart is laggy

descriptor.name: rendererFrameDurationTarget
descriptor.description:
Target duration (in ms) for one frame. The renderer will try to render
as much data as possible in that given timeframe before calling the next
animation frame.
WARNING: this needs to be higher than 16ms since by default
requestAnimationFrame will be called every ~16ms, so our target needs to
be higher to ensure we keep the processor busy

descriptor.name: rendererFrameCountToAverage
descriptor.description:
Number of previous frames to average for the adaptive
progressive rendering

descriptor.name: timeDomain
descriptor.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

descriptor.name: axesDomain
descriptor.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

descriptor.name: extentsData
extentsAction

descriptor.name: zoomStack
descriptor.description: Stack of previous zooms

descriptor.name: zoomInPercentage

Percentage used to calculate new extents when using zoomIn feature.
The higher the number the more it will zoom in. should be less than 1.

descriptor.name: zoomOutPercentage
descriptor.description:
Percentage used to calculate new extents when using zoomOut feature.
The higher the number the more it will zoom out. should be less than 1.

descriptor.name: brushDomains
useCategoryInTooltip
descriptor.description:
Whether the tooltip should show the category name for each
value rather than the axis name.
Will use the category name if defined in seriesConfig, otherwise
a string with the following formatting: 'categoryKey - category'

descriptor.name: showTooltip
descriptor.description: Whether to display the tooltip

descriptor.name: annotationData
resetLassoData
descriptor.description:
When switched clears all the previous selection made
(in _lassoCrosshairData)

descriptor.name: firstDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: secondDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: separator
descriptor.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

descriptor.name: timezone
descriptor.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

descriptor.name: tooltipRequested
descriptor.description: Whether the tooltip should be shown or hidden

descriptor.name: tooltipOrientation
descriptor.description: Specifies the orientation of the event tooltip.

descriptor.name: skipKeys
descriptor.description:
A dev set Object of which keys in the chart data should not be used as axes.

`Required` if axes is not specified.

```
   {
       "Axes_to_skip_1":true,
       "Axes_to_skip_2":true
   }
```

descriptor.name: matchTicks
descriptor.description: A boolean to specify if the axis ticks should align (which affects their individual range). Default (false) is for each have their own ranges and tick marks may not align

descriptor.name: generateAxesFromData
descriptor.description: A boolean to specify if axes are developer set or should be generated from the chart data

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
displayedValues
descriptor.description: Object representing the actual displayed titles for each axis

descriptor.name: tooltipConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the tooltip.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties.
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

descriptor.name: startColorIndex
descriptor.description: Specifies which seriesColorOrder color to start with for assigning the series color

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: getPixelFromData
descriptor.description:
Gets pixel values for data value relating to an axis. data is a number
if margin is specified it will use those to adjust the pixel values
instead of the normal `margin` property
returns an object with pixel values and whether the values are
currently out of bounds

descriptor.name: getDataFromPixel
descriptor.description:
Gets data value for pixel value relating to an axis. Pixel val is a
Y pixel value relating to an axis.
It returns an array with the axis and the value: [axis, value]
please note that the values returned have no guarantee to match any
actual chart data, this is just a conversion based on pixel

descriptor.name: notifyResize
descriptor.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

descriptor.name: assignParentResizable
descriptor.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

descriptor.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
descriptor.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

descriptor.name: resizerShouldNotify
descriptor.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: getImage
descriptor.description:
Takes a graphic "snapshot" of the component and pass results through a callback:
- a canvas containing the graphical snapshot
- a png base 64 data uri

callback object:
{
 canvas: theCanvasObject
 image: "data:image/png;base64;iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACN..."
}

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do
further processing, such as combining different elements snapshot into one image

descriptor.name: getToolbar
descriptor.description: Convenience method for searching for a toolbar in a chart.

descriptor.name: syncCSSTheme
descriptor.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

descriptor.description: Method that takes a datetime string, timezone string, and a formatting string. Returns a formated datetime string.

descriptor.name: resizeChart
descriptor.description: Forces the chart to resize and redraw

descriptor.name: addToMutedAxes
descriptor.description:
Imperatively mute an axis or group of axes.

This function both addes the axes to the mutedAxes list and fires a notifyPath

Can pass a single axis id or an array of axes ids

descriptor.name: removeFromMutedAxes
descriptor.description:
Imperatively mute an axis or group of axes.

This function both addes the axes to the mutedAxes list and fires a notifyPath

Can pass a single axis id or an array of axes ids

descriptor.name: svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: x
descriptor.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: y
descriptor.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: selectedDomain
descriptor.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.name: chartData
descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: offset
descriptor.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

descriptor.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
descriptor.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

descriptor.name: extentsData
extentsAction
descriptor.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: amplitudeExtents
descriptor.description:
Polar's equivalant to chartExtents. Adjusts the max to the given value and takes the min of the min value given and the data's min val: Math.min(amplitudeExtents[0], chartDataMin)

Polar coords must start at the minimum value or else the angle is irrelevant. It also cannot be less than 0.

```
 [minNumber, maxNumber]
```

descriptor.name: centerOffset
descriptor.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: counterClockwise
descriptor.description: whether the polar data should be interepreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

descriptor.name: useDegrees
descriptor.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

descriptor.name: seriesColorList
descriptor.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: defaultSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

descriptor.name: includeAllSeries
descriptor.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

descriptor.name: timeDomain
descriptor.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

descriptor.name: timeData
descriptor.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

descriptor.name: preventResize
descriptor.description: Prevents the chart from automatically resizing to fit its container

descriptor.name: chartHorizontalAlignment
descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: chartVerticalAlignment
descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- top
- bottom

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: debounceResizeTiming
descriptor.description:
Timing (in ms) to be used for iron resize when the chart auto size
(preventResize = false)

descriptor.name: hideRegister
descriptor.description: Allows to hide the register

descriptor.name: layer
descriptor.description: Array of the svg layers

descriptor.name: dynamicMenuConfig
tooltipConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the tooltip cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip and px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

descriptor.name: registerConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.

descriptor.name: showTooltip
descriptor.description: Whether to display the tooltip

descriptor.name: toolbarSubConfig
descriptor.description:
toolbarSubConfig can be passed around from a toolbar to another so that clicking
on a "global" toolbar drives the sub row state for other toolbars

descriptor.name: interactionSpaceConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the interaction space
Please refer to px-vis-interation space (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties.

descriptor.name: toolbarConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the toolbar
Please refer to px-vis-toolbar (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties.
Most interesting properties include:
- config (complex object for customizing the toolbar)
