Defines how to display 0 values

For valid formats and features, see: http://numbrojs.com/format.html
For docs on the component, see: https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-number-formatter/

descriptor.name: firstDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: secondDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: separator
descriptor.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

descriptor.name: timezone
descriptor.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

descriptor.name: svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: orientation
descriptor.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

descriptor.name: axis
descriptor.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

descriptor.name: canvasContext
descriptor.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: canvasLayers
descriptor.description: An array of the generated layers

descriptor.name: renderToCanvas
descriptor.description: Boolean to specify if drawings should render to canvas instead of svg

descriptor.name: seriesColorList
descriptor.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

descriptor.name: seriesConfig
descriptor.description:
A configuration file to associate series order, name, type, and colors.

Association of name, type, and seriesNumber should be developer set. Color and axis are optional.

```
 {
    "seriesKey": {  //seriesKey is a unique identifier for the configuration
        "type": "line",  //line or scatter or both
        "priority": 0, //relative priority is used to decide which series draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc.. CANVAS ONLY
        "markerSymbol": "diamond" //if using scatter different markerSymbol can be used. See "markerSymbol" in px-vis-scatter
        "markerSize": "64" //if using scatter allows to change the size of markers
        "markerScale": "2" //if using scatter allows to scale the size of markers
        "markerFillOpacity": "0.5" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the inside of the marker
        "markerStrokeOpacity": "1" //if using scatter allows to specify the opacity of the outside of the marker
        "strokeWidth": "1" //if using line, allows you to specify the thickness of the line
        "mutedOpacity": "0.3" //opacity value to use when muting a serie
        "name": "My Series",  //human readable name
        "x": "x",  //index or key name for independent variable
        "y": "y",  //index or key name for dependent variable
        "xAxisUnit": "Volt" //Unit to be used for the X axis. Can be ignored if x axis is time based
        "yAxisUnit": "Oranges" //unit to be used for the Y axis.
        "xMin": 0,  // minimum x value
        "xMax": 100,  //maximum x value
        "yMin": 5,  //minimum y value
        "yMax": 50,  //maximum y value
        "hideInRegister": true, //dont show in the register
        "color": "rgb(0,0,0)", //color you want for the series
        "negativeColor": "rgb(255,255,255)", //color you want negative values of the series to be (not all charts)
        "interpolationFunction": Px.d3.curveBasis, //The line interpretor you want to use. See property 'interpolationFunction'
        "axis": {
            "id": "AXIS_ID"   //a unique identifier
            "side": "left"    //the side that you want the axis to draw on, `left` or `right`
            "number": 1       //the order of the axis on each side
         }
    }
 }
```

descriptor.name: defaultSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: Overwrites to the default configuration file. The defaultSeriesConfig is used to fill in the missing parts of seriesConfig. Any option from seriesConfig can be specified in the defaultSeriesConfig and will be automatically used if not defined in the seriesConfig

descriptor.name: includeAllSeries
descriptor.description:
A boolean flag on whether to include all the series in the data.
- `false`: only series defined in the seriesConfig file will be drawn
- `true`: All series in the dataset will be drawn. Defaults will be used for the seriesConfig. If this is used do not specify a seriesConfig

descriptor.name: preventResize
descriptor.description: Prevents the chart from automatically resizing to fit its container

descriptor.name: chartHorizontalAlignment
descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be horizontally aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- left
- right

if any other value is used then left alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: chartVerticalAlignment
descriptor.description:
This allows to decide how the chart
drawing will be vertically aligned when smaller than its container. Values:
- center
- top
- bottom

if any other value is used then top alignment will be chosen

descriptor.name: debounceResizeTiming
descriptor.description:
Timing (in ms) to be used for iron resize when the chart auto size
(preventResize = false)

descriptor.name: tooltipConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the tooltip cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-tooltip and px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties
Most interesting properties include:
- width
- height
- tooltipStyle
- forceDateTimeDisplay

descriptor.name: registerConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the register cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-register (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: xAxisConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the X axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: yAxisConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object used to customize the Y axis cosmetic properties.
Please refer to px-vis-axis (https://github.com/PredixDev/px-vis) for a list of supported properties

descriptor.name: layer
descriptor.description: Array of the svg layers

descriptor.name: wwDataSyncCounter
descriptor.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.name: preventInitialDrawing
descriptor.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

descriptor.name: drawDebounceTime
descriptor.description: Debounce time to use for different types of rendering

descriptor.name: debounceOnPanning
descriptor.description:
Whether the drawings will be debounced on panning the chart.
When not debounced the redraw will happen more often on panning,
which should result in a smoother experience. However if rendering
a big number of points this can have the opposite effect since
it wil redraw too often comapred tot he time taken to re render everything

descriptor.name: rendererMinimumPointsPerFrame
descriptor.description:
The minimum number of points to render per frame
even if the chart is laggy

descriptor.name: rendererFrameDurationTarget
descriptor.description:
Target duration (in ms) for one frame. The renderer will try to render
as much data as possible in that given timeframe before calling the next
animation frame.
WARNING: this needs to be higher than 16ms since by default
requestAnimationFrame will be called every ~16ms, so our target needs to
be higher to ensure we keep the processor busy

descriptor.name: rendererFrameCountToAverage
descriptor.description:
Number of previous frames to average for the adaptive
progressive rendering

descriptor.name: gradientColors
descriptor.description:
Colors used to create a gradient. Can be one of the folowing:
- A single color (string), resulting in that color being applied for the whole "gradient"
- An Array of colors from which a linear gradient while be created
- A custom function that defined a gradient. The function takes an input that will be between 0 and 1 and should return a color based on that input.
- A d3 chromatic scale, which is effectively a function as described above with predefined colors. Please see the "interpolate" functions at https://github.com/d3/d3-scale-chromatic

descriptor.name: navSeriesLimit
descriptor.description: Number of series to display on the navigator

descriptor.name: chartDomainX
descriptor.description: The parent chart's extents

descriptor.name: chartDomainY
descriptor.description: The parent chart's extents

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: getPixelFromData
descriptor.description:
Gets pixel values for data values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). data is an array: [xValue, yValue]
if margin is specified it will use thos to adjust the pixel values
instead of the normal `margin` property
returns an object with the result and whether that result is out of
bounds for the current domain

descriptor.name: getDataFromPixel
descriptor.description:
Gets data values for pixel values relating to a series (series is the id
used in seriesConfig). pixelVal is an array: [xValue, yValue]
please note that the values returned have no guarantee to match any
actual chart data, this is just a conversion based on pixel

descriptor.name: formatTimestamp
descriptor.description: Method that takes a datetime string, timezone string, and a formatting string. Returns a formated datetime string.

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: getToolbar
descriptor.description: Convenience method for searching for a toolbar in a chart.

descriptor.name: muteUnmuteSeries
descriptor.description: Method to mute or umute

descriptor.name: notifyResize
descriptor.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

descriptor.name: assignParentResizable
descriptor.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

descriptor.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
descriptor.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

descriptor.name: resizerShouldNotify
descriptor.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

descriptor.name: getImage
descriptor.description:
Takes a graphic "snapshot" of the component and pass results through a callback:
- a canvas containing the graphical snapshot
- a png base 64 data uri

callback object:
{
 canvas: theCanvasObject
 image: "data:image/png;base64;iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACN..."
}

the data uri can be used to save the image and the canvas object to do
further processing, such as combining different elements snapshot into one image

descriptor.name: syncCSSTheme
descriptor.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: axes
descriptor.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

descriptor.name: dimensions
descriptor.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

descriptor.name: seriesKey
descriptor.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: interpolationFunction
descriptor.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

descriptor.name: lineRadiusLimit
descriptor.description: sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

descriptor.name: timeDomain
descriptor.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

descriptor.name: parallelCoordinates
descriptor.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a parallel coordinates chart

descriptor.name: radialLine
descriptor.description: Boolean specifying if the line is using radial (polar) data

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: width

descriptor.name: offset
descriptor.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.name: eventConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object to define what event should map to what icon and color.
The object has a key being the event name, the value being a configuration object for that event. The configuration object has four properties:
- `color`: A valid color name found in the px-colors-design
- `icon`: the reference to the icon; for 'px' it is an icon set and an icon name; for an image, it is a path
- `type`: 'px', or 'image'.
- `offset`: a 2 element array with the number of pixels to offset the icon. offset[0] is along the x-axis; offset[1] is along the y-axis; necessary for some icons to adjust their values to achieve a better alignment over the event line.
- `size`: a size in pixels for images.
- `enableTooltip` enable/disable tooltip on the event, useful when using a lot of events
- `firstDateTimeFormat`: moment.js format string for the first part of the timestamp if the x Axis is time based
- `separator`: the separator character between the two datetime strings
- `secondDateTimeFormat`: moment.js format string for the second part of the timestamp if the x Axis is time based
- `tooltipOrientation`: orientation of the tooltip
- `timezone`: the moment.js timezone to be used for the timestamp
- `lineWeight`: thickness of the line
- `dataKey`: the access key for the eventData value to be used to position the event
```
Format: {
  "Event-Name-A":{
    "color": "a color, rgb or hex",
    "icon": "a px icon",
    "type": "px",
    "offset":[0,0],
    'enableTooltip': true
  },
  "Event-Name-C":{
    "color": "a color, rgb or hex",
    "icon": "path-to-an-img",
    "type": "image",
    "offset":[0,0]
  },
}
```

```
Example: {
  "Recalibrate":{
    "color": "rgb(0,0,255)",
    "icon": "px-vis:mov",
    "type": "px",
    "offset":[-3,0]
  },
  "Fan stop":{
    "icon": "Dancing_banana.gif",
    "type": "image",
    "offset":[-2,-20],
    "size":"25"
   }
}
```

descriptor.name: defaultEventConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object to define what the default icon should be. This gets used if a) no eventConfig is defined or b) the particular event is not defined in the eventConfig object.

```
Default: {
  'color': 'grey7', //or theme var
  'icon': 'px-vis:mov',
  'type': 'px',
  'offset': 0,
  'lineColor': 'grey9',
  'lineWeight': 1,
  'enableTooltip': true
  'firstDateTimeFormat': 'HH:mm:ss ZZ',
  'secondDateTimeFormat': 'DD MMM YYYY',
  'separator': '|',
  'timezone': 'utc',
  'tooltipOrientation': 'left'
}
```

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: lineRadiusLimit
descriptor.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

descriptor.name: addClipPath
descriptor.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

descriptor.name: canvasContext
descriptor.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: canvasLayers
descriptor.description: An array of the generated layers

descriptor.name: x
descriptor.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: y
descriptor.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

descriptor.name: chartData
descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: interpolationFunction
descriptor.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

descriptor.name: lineRadiusLimit
descriptor.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

descriptor.name: line
descriptor.description: A holder object for the line generator

descriptor.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
descriptor.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: counterClockwise
descriptor.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

descriptor.name: useDegrees
descriptor.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

descriptor.name: seriesId
descriptor.description: A unique ID for each line series

descriptor.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
descriptor.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

descriptor.name: preventInitialDrawing
descriptor.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

descriptor.name: markerMapping
descriptor.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

descriptor.name: markerSymbol
descriptor.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

descriptor.name: markerScale
descriptor.description:
Scales the size of the scatter marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: markerSize
descriptor.description:
the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: markerFillOpacity
descriptor.description:
The opacity of the fill (inside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: markerStrokeOpacity
descriptor.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: mutedOpacity
descriptor.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: rendererType
descriptor.description:
Type of renderer this drawing element should be using. Determines on what
condition the element is going to be drawn
- chartData
- filteredChartData
- highlightData

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Whether to use the clipPath to avoid drawing outside of the axes.

descriptor.name: showArrows
descriptor.description: Boolean to indicate if arrows should be drawn

descriptor.name: arrowConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration options for the arrow
- `symbol`: the symbol name from `markerMapping`. Default: `caret
- `size`: the size of the symbol.
- `scale`: the scale of the symbol (another way to size). Default: 1
- `minLength`: the minimum segment length between points which should get an arrow. Lengths below this min value will not get an arrow. Default: 10

descriptor.name: seriesNumber
descriptor.description: The index of the series, used for calculating its color.

descriptor.name: radial
descriptor.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

descriptor.name: timeData
descriptor.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non-timeseries charts.

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: initializeDrawingSession
descriptor.description:
Defines the appropriate line and symbol generators,
and updates drawing variables: opacity, colors, etc.

descriptor.name: drawClipPath
descriptor.description: Draws a clip path for the canvas.

descriptor.name: renderOneBatch
descriptor.description:
Renders one batch of scatter data (can be one batch during progressive rendering
or all data during render at once).

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: selectionType
descriptor.description:
The zoom selection type:
- xy
- xAxis
- yAxis

descriptor.name: seriesKeys
descriptor.description: Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: counterClockwise
descriptor.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

descriptor.name: useDegrees
descriptor.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

descriptor.name: actionConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events.
Each key represents an event, each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

descriptor.name: handlersCount
descriptor.description: how many handlers are currently setup for each event type

descriptor.name: preventWebWorkerSynchronization
descriptor.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

descriptor.name: wwDataSyncCounter
descriptor.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

descriptor.name: mouseRect
descriptor.description: The actual mouse svg rectangle which can be used to activate the tooltip.

descriptor.name: timeData
descriptor.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non timeseries charts.

descriptor.name: actionMapping
descriptor.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box.

descriptor.name: showTooltip
descriptor.description: If false, will pass `hidden: true` in the tooltip data.

descriptor.name: radial
descriptor.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

descriptor.name: searchRadius
descriptor.description: The search radius for quadtree searches. Only points inside this radius will be returned.

descriptor.name: chartId
descriptor.description: Unique ID of the chart owning this interaction space.

descriptor.name: searchType
descriptor.description: the tooltip/crosshair search: closestPoint, pointPerSeries, allInArea, polygon

descriptor.name: searchFor
descriptor.description: the tooltip search for: `timestamp`, `point`

descriptor.name: iconType
descriptor.description: Name of the icon type.

descriptor.name: cursorType
descriptor.description:
Type of cursor drawing to add:
 - 'none' : default
 - 'crosshair' : draws vertical and horizontal line
 - 'circle' : draws circle of size radius

descriptor.name: useQuadtree
descriptor.description: Boolean specifying if a quadtree should be created and used for searching.

descriptor.name: generateRandomID

Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: markerConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration object to define what marker should map to what icon, color, and row.
The object has a key being the marker name, the value being a configuration object for that marker. The configuration object has four properties:
- `color`: A rgb color value for the fill or stroke.
- `priority`: relative priority is used to decide which type of markers draw on top of each other. priority 0 => smaller priority. 2 draws over 1, which itself draws over 0, etc..
- `markerFillOpacity`: the opacity of the inside of the marker
- `markerStrokeOpacity`: the opacity of the outside of the marker
- `markerSymbol`: the symbol type; see below
- `markerSize`: specifies the size of markers
- `markerScale`: allows to scale the size of markers
- `location`: "top" or "bottom"
- `row`: the row number on the top or the bottom, starting at 0
- `showTooltip`: whether a tooltip should be shown on hover
- `firstDateTimeFormat`: used to format the date part of the timestamp in the tooltip
- `secondDateTimeFormat`: used to format the time part of the timestamp in the tooltip
- `separator`: symbol between date and time in the tooltip
- `timezone`: timezone to use for the timestamp in the tooltip
- `tooltipOrientation`: orientation of the tooltip: "left", "right", "bottom", "top"
- `tooltipLabel`: label to be used in the tooltip for this type. If not defined the key
of this type will be used (which should match 'label' in the markerData)

The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'
```
Example: {
  'myMarkerType':{
      'fillColor': 'rgb(123,0,0)',
      'markerFillOpacity': 0.5,
      'markerSymbol': 'square',
      'markerSize': 4,
      'location': 'top',
      'row': 1,
      'priority': 10,
      'showTooltip': true,
      'tooltipOrientation': 'top'
  }
}
```

descriptor.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: combinedMutedSeries
descriptor.description:
Aimed at regrouping all muted series when different behavior can mute
series (multi series for example: brush + navigator + categories)

descriptor.name: selectedDomain
descriptor.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

descriptor.name: domainChanged
descriptor.description:
Number which increments up when the domain(s) has(have) changed.

0 (false) indicates that domains have not been set.

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw.

descriptor.name: centerOffset
descriptor.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

descriptor.name: radial
descriptor.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a polar chart or a cartesian chart

descriptor.name: redrawSeries
descriptor.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. IE, for charts such as multi-y timeseries, it is unnessary. For charts such as parallel coordinates, it is necessary.

descriptor.name: redrawElems
descriptor.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

descriptor.name: dynamicRedraw
descriptor.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: offset
descriptor.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

descriptor.name: axes
descriptor.description:
Represents all axes plotted by the chart, including muted ones.
It doesn't guarantee to have the same order as the current visual
representation.
Can be set by the developer to define which axes to plot

descriptor.name: dimensions
descriptor.description:
An array of dimensions (axes) which the chart uses. This array represents
the current state of all axes: muted axes won't be included and the
array is ordered based on the current visual representation.
Do not set at a chart level, only read

descriptor.name: seriesKey
descriptor.description: A string specifying which key to use as the series

descriptor.name: dragBehavior
descriptor.description: A holder for the drag behavior

descriptor.name: categoryKey
descriptor.description: A dev set string speciying which key to use as the category to use to color the series lines

descriptor.name: categories
descriptor.description: A dev set array defining the categories values.

descriptor.name: actionConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

descriptor.name: handlersCount
descriptor.description: how many handlers are currently setup for each event type

descriptor.name: orientation
descriptor.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

descriptor.name: extentsData
extentsAction
descriptor.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

descriptor.name: brushDomains
timeDomain
descriptor.description:
Can be used to define a time domain to be used, typically to restrain/filter the amount
of data displayed. Can be used in combination with a px-vis-chart-navigator

descriptor.name: dimension
descriptor.description: The string identifier for the axis

descriptor.name: specialActionsList
descriptor.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box

descriptor.name: brushActions
descriptor.description:
set of actions which should display drawn brushes.
Key is the actionConfig value
value is the brushDomains key

descriptor.name: actionMapping
descriptor.description: set of predefined action that can be used out of the box

descriptor.name: generateRandomID
descriptor.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

descriptor.name: cloneSVGElem
descriptor.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: transition
descriptor.description: Defines our transition for axis snapping

descriptor.name: drawElement
descriptor.description:
Creates the elements to listen to.

For simplicity, we just let d3.brush create the listener elements and control their size

descriptor.name: brushstart
descriptor.description: Stops event propagation on a brush start event

descriptor.name: brushEnd
descriptor.description: Final update on a brush end event

descriptor.name: clearBrush
descriptor.description: Deletes a brush and clears listeners

descriptor.name: deleteAndClearBrush
descriptor.description: Deletes a brush and clears listeners

descriptor.name: svg
descriptor.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

descriptor.name: pxSvgElem
descriptor.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

descriptor.name: width
descriptor.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

descriptor.name: height
descriptor.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

descriptor.name: margin
descriptor.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

descriptor.name: offset
descriptor.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: labelTypeSize
descriptor.description: Defines the base label type size

descriptor.name: title
descriptor.description: The displayed title for the axis

descriptor.name: labelPosition
descriptor.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

descriptor.name: labelRotation
descriptor.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

descriptor.name: labelTranslation
descriptor.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

descriptor.name: series
descriptor.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

descriptor.name: translateAmt
descriptor.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

descriptor.name: titleLocation
descriptor.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

descriptor.name: titleTypeSize
descriptor.description: Defines the Title type size

descriptor.name: strokeWidth
descriptor.description: Defines the axis stroke width

descriptor.name: tickSizeOuter
descriptor.description:
Defines the axis tickSizeOuter. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

descriptor.name: tickValues
descriptor.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

descriptor.name: ticks
descriptor.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

descriptor.name: tickFormat
descriptor.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

descriptor.name: axisColor
descriptor.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

descriptor.name: axisLineColor
descriptor.description: Defines the color for axis lines (overrides axisColor)

descriptor.name: axisTickColor
descriptor.description: Defines the color for axis ticks (overrides axisColor)

descriptor.name: axisLabelColor
descriptor.description: Defines the color for axis labels (overrides axisColor)

descriptor.name: axisTitleColor
descriptor.description: Defines the color for axis title (overrides axisColor)

descriptor.name: drawnTickValues
descriptor.description: Returned tick values from the axis

descriptor.name: innerRadius
descriptor.description:
Number between 0 and 1 defining how much of the inner pie should be cut.
Typically at 0 this is a pie chart, at 0.5 a donut chart and at 1 all
the chart is cut (i.e. not visible).

descriptor.name: donut
descriptor.description:
Whether the chart should be displayed as a donut rather than a pie.
If displayed as a donut, it will by default use 30px as the ring size.
This can be overridden by using the "innerRadius" property (between 0 and 1).

descriptor.name: pieGroup
descriptor.description: A holder object for the series object.

descriptor.name: total
descriptor.description: Total value of all slices.

descriptor.name: radius
descriptor.description: Radius of the pie chart.

descriptor.name: usePercentage
descriptor.description: Whether the values should be displayed in percent.

descriptor.name: preserveDataOrder
descriptor.description:
By default the pie chart slices will be ordered by value.
Set to false to keep the data order.

Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: clipPath
descriptor.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

descriptor.name: seriesClipPath
descriptor.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

descriptor.name: interpolationFunction
descriptor.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

descriptor.name: lineRadiusLimit
descriptor.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

descriptor.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

descriptor.name: markerMapping
descriptor.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

descriptor.name: markerSymbol
descriptor.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

descriptor.name: markerScale

This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: markerSize

the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: markerFillOpacity
descriptor.description:

descriptor.name: markerStrokeOpacity
descriptor.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: mutedOpacity
descriptor.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

descriptor.name: showArrows
descriptor.description: Boolean to indicate if arrows should be drawn

descriptor.name: arrowConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration options for the arrow
- `symbol`: the symbol name from `markerMapping`. Default: `caret
- `size`: the size of the symbol.
- `scale`: the scale of the symbol (another way to size). Default: 1
- `minLength`: the minimum segment length between points which should get an arrow. Lengths below this min value will not get an arrow. Default: 10

descriptor.name: actionConfig
descriptor.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found as a key in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

descriptor.name: withinChart
descriptor.description: Whether the toolbar is within a chart. Drives where the secondary toolbar is displayed.

descriptor.name: chartMargin
descriptor.description: The chart margins. Used to position the secondary toolbar if withinChart is true.

descriptor.name: currentSubConfig
descriptor.description: Current sub-configuration. Can be the result of the config or passed in from another toolbar.

descriptor.name: horizontalAlignment
descriptor.description: Horizontal alignment of the toolbar. Should be 'left' or 'right'.

descriptor.name: subToolbarAlignment
descriptor.description:
Alignment of the sub toolbar. Accepted values:
- horizontal
- vertical
- above (when in a chart, the sub toolbar will be displayed
above the chart rather than on top of it)

descriptor.name: config
descriptor.description:
Configuration object for the toolbar. This object drives what buttons are available on
the toolbar and what they do. Three actions can be used out of the box by passing them
as keys in this config: 'zoom', 'pan' and 'tooltip'.
Any other kind of actions and buttons can be defined through this object. See above for example.

descriptor.name: clone
descriptor.description: deep-copy object into newObject

descriptor.name: reProcessConfig
descriptor.description:
Forces the toolbar to reprocess its current config. Useful when changing
one subproperty of a toolbar item without having to re-copy the whole
config

descriptor.name: switchConfigItems
descriptor.description:
Convenience function for switching a toolbar item to another by hiding
the first one and selecting the second one.
Pass selectToItem true to select the "toItemName" automatically
By default this function will force the toolbar to reprocess the
changes incurred by this switching. If you have more changes to apply
to the config then pass `preventReprocess` true to this function and
call `reProcessConfig` on the toolbar once you applied all your changes

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: xAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains displayed logarithmicly. NOTE: Per d3 docs, this scale cannot cross or include 0.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: yAxisType
descriptor.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `scaleBand`: another ordinal type meant to create a bar instead of a point.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `log`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

descriptor.name: firstDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the first datetime string. The first datetime is shown in normal font weight.

Default is the first datetime string is TIME presented as "15:00:00 +0000"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: secondDateTimeFormat
descriptor.description:
Defines the format for the second datetime string. The second datetime is shown in bold font weight.

Default is the second datetime string is DATE presented as "12 Feb 2016"

For valid string formats, see: http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/

descriptor.name: separator
descriptor.description: Defines a separator character between the two datetime strings.

descriptor.name: timezone
descriptor.description:
Sets what timezone the event time should display in.

Timezone defaults to UTC time. If a valid timezone is specified, then times include daylight savings time if applicable.

For a list of valid timezones, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

For more details on timezones, see: http://momentjs.com/timezone/

descriptor.name: completeSeriesConfig
descriptor.description: A configuration file generated by the chart behavior based on seriesConfig and defaultSeriesConfig.

descriptor.name: mutedSeries
descriptor.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

descriptor.name: hardMute
descriptor.description:
Allows for a "hard" muting of the series/categories: the
series/category won't show up
in the tooltip anymore, it's tooltip data won't be shown in the register
and its extents won't be taken into account by the chart

descriptor.name: fixed
descriptor.description:
By default, the branding bar within the app header container will minimize as the user scrolls away.
If this property is set, the branding bar will stay fixed as the user scrolls away.

descriptor.name: segmentPathsWith
descriptor.description:
Valid URI-safe character used to seperate URL path segments. Defaults
to '/' (e.g. the path ['about','company-info'] would be joined as
'about/company-info').

Choose a safe, unreserved URI character to ensure there are no issues.
See [RFC 3986](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt) for a list of
unsafe and reserved characters. In general, use one of: `-`, `.`,
`_`, or `~`. Note that character should not occur in any paths.

descriptor.name: segmentModelsWith
descriptor.description:
Valid URI-safe character used to seperate different models in the
URL. Defaults to '~' (e.g. the nav path ['about','company-info'] and
asset path ['dashboards','trucks'] would be joined as
'about/company-info~dashboards/trucks'.

Choose a safe, unreserved URI character to ensure there are no issues.
See [RFC 3986](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt) for a list of
unsafe and reserved characters. In general, use one of: `-`, `.`,
`_`, or `~`. Note that character should not occur in any paths.

descriptor.name: route
descriptor.description:
Bind this property to the `route` exposes by the <app-location> element.
Updates to the URL path will be propagated to `route.path` and decoded
by this component to update the app-nav and app-asset models. Updates
to the models will be pushed to the URL path.

descriptor.name: useHashAsPath
descriptor.description:
Set to `true` if the URL path will be prefixed with a `#` character.
This should also be enabled on the <app-location> element that shares
its route with this component.

descriptor.name: updateNavRoute
descriptor.description:
Set to `true` to sync a <px-app-nav> component's state with the URL
bar. See the `navRoute` property for help on binding changes.

descriptor.name: navRoute
descriptor.description:
Bind this property to a <px-app-nav> component's `selectedRoute`
property to keep the navigation state in sync with the URL path.
Must enable `updateNavRoute` for this to work.

descriptor.name: navPathString
descriptor.description:
Read-only string that is computed from the `navRoute`. Will be
pushed into the URL path.

descriptor.name: updateAssetRoute
descriptor.description:
Set to `true` to sync the state of components that use the Asset Graph
Behavior with the URL path. See the `assetRoute` property for help
on binding changes.

descriptor.name: assetRoute
descriptor.description:
Bind this property to a the `selectedRoute` property of one or more
components that use the Asset Graph Behavior to keep the selected
asset state in sync with the URL path. Must enable `updateAssetRoute` for
this to work.

descriptor.name: assetPathString
descriptor.description:
Read-only string that is computed from the `assetRoute`. Will be
pushed into the URL path.

descriptor.name: path
descriptor.description:
Read-only string that is computed from the `navRoute` and
`assetRoute` models (if they are enabled). Will be used to set the
URL path.

descriptor.name: encodeAllPaths
descriptor.description:
Encodes multiple route models into a path string that can be passed to
a JavaScript router (or to `window.location`). Pass an object with
`navRoute` and `assetRoute` route arrays and an optional configuration
object.

To generate a path for nav and asset items, call with the following
arguments:

```
  encodeAllPaths(
    {
      navRoute: ['dashboards', 'truck-locations'],
      assetRoute: ['us', 'calif', 'bay-area']
    },
    {
      segmentPathsWith: '/',
      segmentModelsWith: '~',
      prefixFirstPath: true
    }
  );
```

The following string will be returned:

```
  '/dashboards/truck-locations~/us/calif/bay-area'
```

## Passing routes

The `routes` argument should be an object with one or both of the
following keys:

  - `navRoute`: An array of strings
  - `assetRoute`: An array of strings

## Configuring the encoder

The following `options` can be passed to change the output:

  - `segmentPathsWith`: Any URI-safe character (one of `-`, `.`, `_`, or `~`)
  - `segmentModelsWith`: Any URI-safe character (one of `-`, `.`, `_`, or `~`)
  - `prefixFirstPath`: Adds the path segment character to the front of the returned path

descriptor.name: encodePath
descriptor.description:
Encodes a route (an array of string) into a path string that can be passed
to a JavaScript router (or to `window.location`). Pass an array of
strings and a URI-safe character to segment the strings with (e.g. '/').
Optionally set the `prefixFirstPath` argument to true to add the segment
character to the front of the path.

For example, given the following settings:

```
  encodePath(['dashboards', 'truck-locations'], '/', true);
```

The following string will be returned:

```
  '/dashboards/truck-locations'
```

params.name: route
params.description: an array of string

params.name: segmentWith
params.description: a URI-safe character that will be placed between each path segment

params.name: prefixFirstPath
params.description: adds the segment character to the front of the returned path

descriptor.name: decodePath
descriptor.description:
Decodes a URI path into arrays of route strings that can be passed to
other components to synchronise state.

## Decode navigation path only

To decode a path string that only contains nav items, call the method
with the path to decode and the following options:

```
  decodePath('/dashboards/truck-locations', {
    navRoute: true
  });
```

The following object will be returned:

```
  {
    navRoute: ['dashboards', 'truck-locations']
  }
```

## Decode navigation and asset paths

To decode a path string that contains nav items and asset items,
call the method with the path to decode and the following options:

```
  decodePath('/dashboards/truck-locations~/us/calif/bay-area', {
    navRoute: true,
    assetRoute: true
  });
```

The following object will be returned:

```
  {
    navRoute: ['dashboards', 'truck-locations'],
    assetRoute: ['us', 'calif', 'bay-area']
  }
```

## Configuring segment seperators

The characters used to seperate segments of each path, and the character
used to join multiple model paths, can be set through the options
object to any URI-safe character (one of `-`, `.`, `_`, or `~`).

To decode this custom path, use the following options:

```
  decodePath('alerts.inbox_factories.factory1.area38', {
    navRoute: true,
    assetRoute: true,
    segmentPathsWith: '.',
    segmentModelsWith: '_'
  });
```

The following object will be returned:

```
  {
    navRoute: ['alerts', 'inbox'],
    assetRoute: ['factories', 'factory1', 'area38']
  }
```

## All configurations

The following `options` can be passed to change the output:

  - `navRoute`: A boolean, if `true` the nav route will be decoded
  - `assetRoute`: A boolean, if `true` the asset route will be decoded
  - `segmentPathsWith`: Any URI-safe character (one of `-`, `.`, `_`, or `~`)
  - `segmentModelsWith`: Any URI-safe character (one of `-`, `.`, `_`, or `~`)
  - `stripPrefix`: Strips the `segmentPathsWith` character from the front of the path, if it is found there

descriptor.name: isDeepEqual
descriptor.description:
Determines if two arrays of strings are deeply equal - returns `true`
if both arrays have the same strings in the same order. Helps perform
checks on the equality of arrays of route strings.
